newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Petron sets 5.374 billion peso 97 capex.
newsitem.headline: Petron sets 5.374 billion peso 97 capex.

text.p: Philippine oil refiner Petron Corp said on Tuesday its board has approved a 5.374 billion peso capital expenditure programme for 1997.
The company budgeted a 6.7 billion peso capital outlay for 1996, the biggest in its history.
Petron said in a statement its 1997 capex budget is for service stations, manufacturing, storage, distribution and information technology projects.

Petron said its board also approved the awarding of 964 million peso engineering and procurement contracts for the expansion of its refinery to a consortium of Daelim Engineering Co Ltd of South Korea and Mitsui & Co Ltd of Japan.
Petron is planning to expand its refinery from 165,000 barrels of oil per day (bopd) to 180,000 bopd.
